document.docTitle: Neophyllobius womersleyi Fan & Walter, 2006, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Camerobia and Neophyllobius (Acari: Prostigmata: Camerobiidae) from Australia, with the descriptions of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Camerobia and Neophyllobius (Acari: Prostigmata: Camerobiidae) from Australia, with the descriptions of two new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype , adult female, from under bark, Waywood ph, Adelaide, Australia , coll. F. Womersley,
15 Sept. 1940
. In SAM .

Paratype ,
1 adult
female, from under Suc bark, Australia , coll. F. Womersley,
4 Apr. 1937
. In SAM .

Adult female. Peritremes with 1 loop; palptarsus with 2 + 2 eupathidia + 1 ; a pair of pdx present; idiosomal setae lanceolate, c
1
, c
2
, d

and f

= 1.1: 1.1: 1.1: 1.0; femora (I–IV) with 4, 3 , 2, 1 . Setae on genua lanceolate, ratio I: II: III: IV= 1.0: 1.1: 1.3 (1.2–1.3): 2.1 (1.7–2.1).

Gnathosoma. Stylophore stumpy, 42 ( 42–50 ); movable digits 17 ( 17–20 ); peritremes with 1 loop. Palp 37 ( 37–42 ); counts of setae and solenidia from trochanter to tarsus: 0, 2 , 1, 3 + 1 claw, 2 + 2 eupathidia + 1 solenidion (). Subcapitular setae m 20 , distance m–m , 25 ( 24–25 ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Idiosoma. Nearly circular in shape, 247 ( 220–247 ) long, 177 ( 177–200 ) wide. Prodorsum bearing 1 pair of eyes ( 7 in diameter), 1 pair of postocular bodies ( 10 ( 10–13 ) in diameter) and 5 pairs of lanceolate setae,
vi 45
( 45–60 ), ve 38 ( 38–50 ), sci 42 ( 42–47 ), sce 38 ( 38–45 ), pdx 48 ( 48–50 ); distances:
vi– vi

subSubSection.paragraph:
Legs. Length (from base of trochanter to tip of tarsus): leg I 366 ( 366–395 ), leg II 283 ( 283–328 ), leg III 330 ( 330–367 ), leg IV 377 ( 377–411 ). Setae on genua lanceolate, IV longest, length I–IV: 45 ( 45–55 ),
II 50
( 50–62 ), 57 ( 57–67 ), 95 , ratio I: II: III: IV= 1.0: 1.1: 1.3 (1.2–1.3): 2.1 (1.7–2.1). Tibiae I–IV each with 1 solenidion:
I 14
( 14–17 ),
II 13
( 10–13 ),
III 11
( 10–11 ),
IV 10
( 10–13 ). Tarsi I–II each with 1 solenidion:
I 6
( 5–6 ),
II 4 .
Counts of setae and solenidia on legs I–IV: coxae
1 a
+ 2, 1 , 2, 2 ; trochanters 1, 1 , 1, 1 ; femora 4, 3 , 2, 1 ; genua 1 + 1, 1 + 1, 1 , 1 ; tibiae 9 + 1, 8 + 1, 8 + 1, 7 + 1 ; tarsi 10 + 1, 10 + 1, 8 , 8 .

Neophyllobius womersleyi
sp. n.
resembles
N. aegyptium
Soliman & Zaher, 1967
in having similar setal numbers on the legs, but can be readily distinguished from the latter because the setae on the genua are lanceolate and the seta on genu IV is the longest.
